results.title: Koonyets Sankt-Peterburga = The End of St. Petersburg (Musical Soundtrack)
results.brief_description:
Originally made to commemorate the tenth year of the overthrow of Czarist Russia, Pudovkin’s film tells the story of a peasant boy who comes to St. Petersburg in 1917 in search of work and witnesses the October Revolution. Set against the background of the historical events which culminated in the attack on the Winter Palace the film contains graphic anti-war statements. Also available on LD, 16mm and VHS.

Credits: Director, Vsevolod Pudovkin ; writer, Nathan Zarkhi ; photography, Anatoli Golovnya.
Cast: A. Chistyakov.

results.title: Kontraste (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Produced by an international team of amateur film makers aged 18 to 23, this is an experiment in the synthesis of ballet and film techniques. Elements of both dance-drama and traditional ballet are used in a psychological fantasy set against the ruins of a city, describing the impact of new people and strange feelings on youth. The “Contrasts” are those of white to black, youth to experience, the unreal formality of the ballet as opposed to the rough reality of the setting. Sound effects and music only.

results.title: Konrad Lorenz: science of animal behaviour
results.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Documents the work of Konrad Lorenz in animal behaviour, describing his studies with wild geese and his findings on the function of rank in animal social structure. Shows his experiments concerning imprinting and communication, where the geese adopt the experimenter as mother immediately after birth. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.

results.title: Kondom Agaundo
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Outlines the background and life of Kondom Agaundo, a native leader elected to the Legislative Council as a representative of the people of the Highlands of Papua and New Guinea. Shows his family and tribal life; his leadership, nomination, election and first speech in the House where he tells of his desire to learn.

results.title: Konarak: the sun temple of Orissa
results.creator_credit: P.S. Das Gupta, Hari S. Das Gupta and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A 13th century temple to the Sun God on the coast of Orissa State. Pilgrims pray on the seashore at sunrise and then travel inland to make the ritual circumnambulations of the temple before entering the inner sanctum. The temple is designed as a great chariot for the Sun God, and its carvings and statues embody a wealth of religious symbolism. Various figures represent the phases of the solar cycle and the heavenly beings.

results.title: Konarak
results.brief_description: Konarak is near Puri in the corner of Orissa. This temple, also called the black pagoda, was built in the 13th century in honour of the sun god, Surya. Because of its carvings, the temple is awesome and magnificent and this non-narrated film offers a magnificent glimpse into the daily and spiritual life of the period in which it was built.

results.title: Kompani bilong yumi
results.creator_credit: Lionel Hudson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Surveys the varied activities of Namasu, a commercial co-operative owned mostly by native New Guineans, marketing products such as coffee, tea, wool, copra, and handicrafts, and encouraging local industry and trade generally in New Guinea.

results.title: Kolyma
results.creator_credit: Murray Battle, Angus MacQueen, Tom Roberts, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
Kolyma is in North-East Russia, on the wild Pacific Coast and under Stalin’s reign it was a Gulag prison camp. The Gulags were a network of forced labour-camps throughout the Soviet Union and literally tens of millions of Soviet citizens were imprisoned in the camps during the 1930s and 1940s. Kolyma is a gold mine territory and the prisoners were forced to work the mines, clear the forests while enduring horrific climatic conditions in the freezing Siberian terrain. Interviews with ex-prisoners who served sentences ranging from ten to twenty-five years, detail the miserable conditions in which they lived and worked, while interviews with the camp administrators make it clear that throughout the prison system it was wide-spread knowledge that the majority of prisoners where innocent of their crimes. This final episode of “The Hand of Stalin” documents with ferocious passion, the damage done by a totalitarian ruler in his thirst for personal power and by his blind adherance to the dogmas of a Communist faith.

results.title: Kolya
results.creator_credit: Jan Sverak, Eric Abraham, Pandora Cinema, Ceska televize, Portobello Pictures and Biograf Jan Sverak
results.brief_description: Louka is a middle-aged Czech who loves women, hates the idea of commitment and owes more money than he can earn playing the cello in a funeral orchestra. When a friend suggests he make a little ‘easy money’ by entering into an arranged marriage, with a Russian woman seeking citizenship, Louka reluctantly agrees. But it’s a decision that will throw his life into chaos…and change it forever. When the marriage is completed his new ‘wife’ is on the first plane to Germany leaving behind her five year old son for Louka to care for. So now this confirmed bachelor must become a father.. this grumpy old man and an innocent kid must learn to live together, even though they don’t speak the same language. This is a funny, touching and unforgettable story that will touch your heart. Winner of the Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Contains Czech and Russian language with English subtitles.
